intro: Prunus mutabilis f. octopes, commonly known as the eight-lobed cherry, is a unique cultivar of the Prunus genus. It is characterized by its distinctive flowers that change color from white to pink to red as they bloom. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 2 to 6 meters. Its foliage consists of ovate to lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. The fruit is a small, dark red drupe that ripens in late summer, adding ornamental value to the plant.
